metadata.Title: CVE-2021-42327 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
dp_link_settings_write indrivers/gpu/drm/amd/display/amdgpu_dm/amdgpu_dm_debugfs.c in the Linuxkernel through 5.14.14 allows a heap-based buffer overflow by an attackerwho can write a string to the AMD GPU display drivers debug filesystem.There are no checks on size within parse_write_buffer_into_params when ituses the size of copy_from_user to copy a userspace buffer into a 40-byteheap buffer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required
